entity.name: Dripsy
entity.description: Unstyled, responsive UI primitives for React Native + Web.
entity.descriptionClean: Unstyled, responsive UI primitives for React Native + Web.

example.codeHighlighted: <View sx={{ bg: '$primary', height: [100, 200] }} />

entity.name: Emotion
entity.description: CSS-in-JS library designed for high performance style composition.
entity.descriptionClean: CSS-in-JS library designed for high performance style composition.

example.codeHighlighted: const Card = styled.View` background-color: ${props => props.theme.primary}; height: 100px; `

entity.name: Inline styling
entity.description: A straightforward method of applying styles directly within the component using the style prop.
entity.descriptionClean: A straightforward method of applying styles directly within the component using the style prop.

example.codeHighlighted: <View style={{ height: 100, backgroundColor: "red" }} />

entity.name: NativeWind
entity.description: A utility-first design system for React Native that leverages Tailwind CSS for styling components.
entity.descriptionClean: A utility-first design system for React Native that leverages Tailwind CSS for styling components.

example.codeHighlighted: <View className="h-[100] md:h-[200] bg-primary" />

entity.name: react-native-unistyles
entity.description: A cross-platform library that enables you to share up to 100% of your styles across all platforms. It combines the simplicity of StyleSheet with the performance of C++.
entity.descriptionClean: A cross-platform library that enables you to share up to 100% of your styles across all platforms. It combines the simplicity of StyleSheet with the performance of C++.

example.codeHighlighted: const stylesheet = createStyleSheet(theme => ({ card: { height: { xs: 100, md: 200 }, backgroundColor: theme.colors.primary } }) function Component() { const { styles } = useStyles(stylesheet) return <View style={styles.card} /> }

entity.name: React Strict DOM
entity.description: React Strict DOM (RSD) standardizes the development of styled React components for web and native.
entity.descriptionClean: React Strict DOM (RSD) standardizes the development of styled React components for web and native.

example.codeHighlighted: const theme = css.createTheme({ /* ... */ }) const styles = css.create({ card: { height: 100, backgroundColor: theme.primary, } }) function Component() { return ( <html.div style={styles.card} /> ); }

entity.name: Restyle
entity.description: A type-enforced system for building UI components in React Native with TypeScript. It's a library for building UI libraries, with themability as the core focus.
entity.descriptionClean: A type-enforced system for building UI components in React Native with TypeScript. It's a library for building UI libraries, with themability as the core focus.
entity.descriptionHtml: A type-enforced system for building UI components in React Native with TypeScript. It's a library for building UI libraries, with themability as the core focus.

example.codeHighlighted: <Box backgroundColor="primary" height={{ sm: 100, md: 200 }} />

entity.name: StyleSheet API
entity.description: A built-in React Native API for creating stylesheets that improve performance and organization of styles.
entity.descriptionClean: A built-in React Native API for creating stylesheets that improve performance and organization of styles.

example.codeHighlighted: const styles = StyleSheet.create({ card: { height: 100, backgroundColor: "red" } }) function Component() { return <View style={styles.card} /> }

entity.name: styled components
entity.description: Visual primitives for the component age. Use the best bits of ES6 and CSS to style your apps without stress. Utilising tagged template literals and the power of CSS, styled-components allows you to write actual CSS code to style your components.
entity.descriptionClean: Visual primitives for the component age. Use the best bits of ES6 and CSS to style your apps without stress. Utilising tagged template literals and the power of CSS, styled-components allows you to write actual CSS code to style your components.

example.codeHighlighted: const Card = styled.View` background-color: ${props => props.theme.primary}; height: 100px; `

entity.name: StyleX
entity.description: The styling system that powers Meta products (e.g. Facebook, Instagram).
entity.descriptionClean: The styling system that powers Meta products (e.g. Facebook, Instagram).

example.codeHighlighted: const vars = stylex.defineVars({ /* ... */ }) const styles = stylex.create({ card: { backgroundColor: vars.primary, height: vars.height, } }) <View {...stylex.props(styles.base)} />

entity.name: Tamagui
entity.description: A style library for React and React Native with a large typed superset of the React Native style API, with no outside dependencies.
entity.descriptionClean: A style library for React and React Native with a large typed superset of the React Native style API, with no outside dependencies.

example.codeHighlighted: const Card = styled(View, { height: { sm: 100, md: 200, }, backgroundColor: '$primary', });

entity.name: Tailwind React Native Classnames (twrnc)
entity.description: A simple, expressive API for TailwindCSS + React Native, written in TypeScript.
entity.descriptionClean: A simple, expressive API for TailwindCSS + React Native, written in TypeScript.

example.codeHighlighted: <View style={tw("h-[100] md:h-[200] bg-primary")} />
